I have a reproducible case:

- Limit number of editors to 2, enable auto-closing
- Enable "Auto-closed Parenthesis'"
- Open A.java, type ( 
-> the closing paren is inserted, linked mode is on
- save (linked mode stays)
- Open B.java, type (, save (same effect)
- Open C.java, type (

-> get the exception below. The one reported in comment 0 is just triggered by a
different event, but the same problem.

The bug is that LinkedModeUI does not listen to the input change in the editor.
When the editor input gets changed, the linked mode stays active, later on
referring to the viewer's document, which has changed.

A fix would have to ensure that linked mode is exited upon editor input change.

Created an attachment (id=12456)
LinkedModeUI.diff

Adds ITextInputListener to the interfaces implemented by Closer. Linked mode is
left upon inputDocumentAboutToBeChanged.

This ensures that linked mode is left when the document is changed or the
editor is closed.
*** Bug 67777 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
